newsitem.title: ESTONIA: TRADERS ANGRY OVER STOCK MARKET DELAYS.
newsitem.headline: TRADERS ANGRY OVER STOCK MARKET DELAYS.

text.p: Stock market traders were angry on Thursday as technical problems delayed trade for 30 minutes in some banks and almost an hour for others.

The Tallinn stock exchange said that it was investigating the problem and a report on whether the source of the problem is the exchange's or outside its control is expected after a technical department meeting this afternoon.
"We are definitely angry," one trader said. "This not a once a month problem but things that reappear," he added.
Within the last two weeks several major banks were completly cut off from dealing during morning trade, dealers said.

"This morning was very difficult with clients wanting to place urgent orders and a local news agency sending incorrect profit figures for one bank and no connection to the exchange," another trader added.
